Daily Market Brief:
northmantrader.com/2025/09/0‚Ä¶

The Move Index (the Bond Market's VIX Index) has jumped over 10 points in the last two days (bottom panel) for the biggest two-day increase since April (the middle of the post-Liberation Day market freakout). 

The Index level (top panel) is now at its highest level since late July.
---
The MOVE is an index of options' implied volatility of 30-day interest rates from 2-year to 30-year. 

So, the MOVE is a market expectation of what MIGHT BE coming ... the bond market is "bracing" for a significant uptick in volatility.

2/2

At the same time, continuing claims have slumped to a two-month low.

Again, the same warning applies. Going into the Labor Day weekend, this data can get "screwy." 

It's too early to say continuing claims fall is a sign of labor market strength.

1/2

Claims jumped

But this was the week before Labor Day.  This data can be "screwy" around holidays.

See June 6th at 250k. The week after Memorial Day. That peaked did not hold.

It's too early to say that the recent rise in claims into Labor Day is a sign of a weakness.

Nvidia $NVDA guided for its largest ever sequential increase in revenue in Q3 at ~$7.3 billion QoQ.

OpenAI is set to produce its first AI chip next year with Broadcom $AVGO, per the FT, with plans to put the chip to use internally rather than selling it to external customers. 

$NVDA $AMD

Broadcom $AVGO CEO Hock Tan:

‚ÄúLast quarter, one of these prospects released production orders to Broadcom, and we have accordingly characterized them as a qualified customer for XPUs, and in fact, have secured over $10 billion of orders of AI racks based on our XPUs.‚Äù

Nvidia $NVDA on the GB300 ramp:

‚ÄúThe current run rate is back at full speed, producing approximately 1,000 racks per week. This output is expected to accelerate even further throughout the third quarter as additional capacity comes online.‚Äù
Broadcom's $AVGO Semiconductor revenue growth accelerated 9 points from Q2 to 26% YoY in Q3, fueled by 68% growth in AI revenue.

Broadcom $AVGO guided for $17.4B in revenue in fiscal Q4, ahead of estimates for $17B, on strong AI momentum.

AI revenue was guided at $6.2B in Q4, up ~68% YoY and its eleventh consecutive quarter of growth.

Broadcom $AVGO reported 22% revenue growth to $15.95B, with EPS up 36% to $1.69, beating on the top and bottom line. 

AI revenue beat slightly at $5.2B, up 68% YoY.

Pacifico Energy is planning a 5GW off-grid data center campus in Texas suited for hyperscaler needs, with the first GW set to be delivered by 2028 and the full 5GW by 2030.

$NVDA $MSFT $GOOG $AMZN

Broadcom $AVGO is expected to report 21% revenue growth to $15.82B in fiscal Q3, with EPS up 34% to $1.66. 

Semiconductor revenue was guided at $9.1B, up 25% YoY, with AI revenue expected to be $5.1B, up 65% YoY.

Despite having ten consecutive quarters of <20% YoY growth, Morgan Stanley projects $AMZN AWS could accelerate and return to 20%+ YoY growth in 2026 as it works to expand capacity to meet demand. 

$NVDA $AVGO $MRVL $MSFT $GOOG

UBS on Broadcom $AVGO ahead of earnings:

‚ÄúWe expect in-line results and potential upside to Street's ~$17.0B for FQ4 (Oct) driven by better unit trends for TPUv6p. ‚Ä¶ Our expectation is that TPUv6p will experience a sharp ramp in 2H25.‚Äù

OpenAI is said to be planning a >1GW data center campus in India, though the location and timeline for construction remain uncertain.
